definitions.definition: the direction that you look towards to see the sun rise; one of the four main points of the compass

examples.text: A gale was blowing from the east.
a town to the east of *(= further east than)* Chicago
The train line facilitates travel between east and west.

definitions.definition: the eastern part of a country, region or city

examples.text: The east of the country is especially popular with tourists.
Around 2 000 teachers from around the East of England attended the conference.
I was born in the East, but now live in San Francisco.
Elsewhere in the East, wet, unsettled weather will continue until the weekend.
House prices in the east have risen significantly over the last five years.
There's been a severe earthquake in the east of the country.

definitions.definition: the countries of Asia, especially China, Japan and India

examples.text: European traders started trading with the East in the 15th century.

definitions.definition: the Communist countries of Central and Eastern Europe

examples.text: the centrally planned system of the East

wordOrigin: Old English ēast-, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch oost and German ost, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin aurora, Greek auōs ‘dawn’.
